definition: to lower oneself to sb's level/to argue with sb less well-informed
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
sort/kind/class/way/manner
see 般樂|般乐[pan2 le4]
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to know/knowledge/Taiwan pr. [shi4]
to record/to write a footnote

sentences.english: You don't want to bother yourself arguing with the likes of him.
I am not going to lower myself to his level.
Others use the words of ordinary people, called with the bad people in general do not see.
sentences.chinese: 用人家老百姓的话说，叫作不跟小人一般见识。

sentences.english: Do you want to behave like him?
sentences.chinese: 希望你不要跟某些人一般见识。

definition: a person of great moral stature does not remember the offenses committed by one of low moral stature
pinyin: da4 ren2 bu4 ji4 xiao3 ren2 guo4

unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to sulk/to squabble
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to get angry
not worthwhile
a real man doesn't fight with womenfolk (idiom)

definition: variant of 慪氣|怄气[ou4 qi4]
meddling in other people's business
to mind/to take offense
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker

to calm down/to quell one's anger
